text:
Blackpink is a South Korean girl group that debuted on 8 August 2016. The members are Jisoo, Jennie, Rosé, and Lisa.
They are the highest-charting female K-pop act on both "Billboard" Hot 100 and "Billboard" 200. They are also the first and only K-pop girl group to enter and top the "Billboards Emerging Artists chart. They are also the first female K-pop group to have four number-one singles on "Billboards World Digital Song Sales chart. Their song "Ddu-Du Ddu-Du" was the most-viewed Korean music video in the first 24 hours on YouTube. In January 2019, it became the most viewed music video by a K-pop group on YouTube. Blackpink was also the first female K-pop group to perform at Coachella.
